title: Bilboquet, 1967-48-42-a,b, possibly ca. 1780
provenance: Various owners, Collections of French and American Furtniture, Paintings, Tapestries, and other Art Properties, including Relics of Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette, Sale Catalogue, Parke-Bernet Galleries, Nov. 22, 1941, no. 294
description: Stick and ball toy: ball pierced with hole through center, featuring black engraved images of putti in various stages of play, including several using a Bilboquet; foliage, flowers, pair of doves on plinth in background; continous festoon above play vignettes; top and bottom of ball feature continuous acanthus leaf motifs; ball attached by green silk cord to spirally fluted, baluster-turned stick; stick engraved with additional acanthus leaf motifs near top and bottom;  continous coin pattern carved above and below; stick inscribed near top:  "MENUS PLAISIRS DU ROY, VERSAILLES." Narrow post at top of stick  inserts into larger hole at the bottom of the ball.
